A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

incidents.name: Free, Pro, and Biz Bandwidth Alliance customers experiencing Tiered Cache degradation

incident_updates.body: Free, Pro, and Biz Customers with Bandwidth Alliance origins are experiencing Tiered Cache degradation where Tiered Cache is not engaging as expected. This results in higher cache misses and more requests to the origin.

incidents.name: Network Route Leak

incident_updates.body: Between 18:28 to 18:33 UTC, one of Cloudflare's upstream transit providers experienced a route leak, affecting network performance in some locations. We are working to mitigate impact to Internet users in this region.

incidents.name: Accidental "major incident" notification

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We understand how concerning it must have been to receive an unexpected email about a major incident. The message you may have received was sent in error. During a routine internal drill, a test notification was inadvertently distributed externally.

Please rest assured there is no active major issue impacting Cloudflare services  everything is operating normally.

Were truly sorry for any confusion or worry this may have caused you or your team. No action is needed on your side, and you can safely disregard that email. For the most accurate and up-to-date information at any time, please refer to our Cloudflare Status Page (https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/).

Thank you for your understanding, and for trusting Cloudflare.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is aware of and investigating an issue with Cloudflare Pages which potentially impacts multiple customers: Function deployment is not operating correctly, and as such they may not be deployed, or be delayed. This issue only impacts new changes, existing sites and traffic to those sites are not affected.
We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: Issues with new Cloudflare Tunnel and WARP connections on 2025-08-10

incident_updates.body:
An issue prevented a subset of new Cloudflare Tunnel and WARP connections from being established between 07:00 and 08:45 AM UTC on Sunday, August 10th. This problem has been fully resolved, and all services are operating normally.

During this time window, customers may have experienced errors when attempting to restart or initiate new connections via cloudflared. This may also have impacted customers using WARP-to-WARP connectivity or Magic WAN customers who leverage WARP as an on-ramp.

The issue was limited to the establishment of new connections; existing tunnels and connections were not affected. This issue also did not affect any other Cloudflare services.

Our team has addressed the root cause, and we will continue to monitor the service to ensure continued stability. We apologize for any disruption this may have caused our customers.

incidents.name: Issues with 1.1.1.1 public resolver

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare observed and fixed an issue which potentially impacted multiple users on 1.1.1.1 public resolver,  in all regions. A higher latency than usual would have been observed.

The impact occurred on  2025-08-01, from 14:03 to 19:23 UTC.

The issue is resolved now.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Pages: Compression issues with custom hostnames

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare has identified an issue with our Pages feature: Customers under our Free plan using custom hostnames may experience specific pages unexpectedly returning zstd compression mode. Customers experiencing this issue can add a compression rule to enforce brotli or gzip compression to temporarily circumvent the problem. Nevertheless, we are working to mitigate this issue, more updates to follow shortly.
